text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to refer to Section 2(3) of the Arbitration Act 1996 when considering whether it is appropriate for the court to act. The candidate answer extensively discusses Section 44 of the Arbitration Act 1996, which governs the court's power to grant interim relief in support of arbitration, and Section 9, which deals with stays of proceedings. However, Section 2(3) (which deals with the scope of Part I of the Act, specifically concerning whether the Act applies to agreements governed by the law of England and Wales) is not mentioned at all in the context of determining the appropriateness of court action.", "criterion_id": "27a7166e-59ca-4a59-8eb6-7e17bb61462f"}
